definitions: having no one else present or going along with one; alone or solitary
performed or sung without instrumental backing or harmonic support from other musicians
examples: The unaccompanied minor traveled alone on the flight
She made the unaccompanied journey through dangerous territory
His unaccompanied voice filled the empty cathedral
The choir performed an unaccompanied piece beautifully

definitions: not officially recognized or authorized by the appropriate governing body or professional organization
examples: The unaccredited college couldn't issue valid degrees
Students avoid unaccredited programs that lack recognition

definitions: not used to or experienced with something; unfamiliar with a particular situation or activity
examples: She felt unaccustomed to the formal atmosphere
His unaccustomed hands struggled with the delicate work

definitions: not admitted to or accepted as true, valid, or existing despite being real
deliberately overlooked or disregarded without giving proper credit or attention
examples: Her unacknowledged contributions went unnoticed for years
The unacknowledged problem continued to worsen
His unacknowledged presence made everyone uncomfortable
The letter remained unacknowledged despite multiple attempts

definitions: plain and simple without ornamental features, embellishments, or decorative elements
examples: The unadorned walls gave the room a minimalist feel
She preferred unadorned clothing without patterns or frills

definitions: not mixed or diluted with any different or extra elements; completely pure
complete and unrestricted in quality or degree; utter and absolute
examples: The chef insisted on unadulterated ingredients for authenticity
They sought unadulterated honey straight from the hive
She expressed unadulterated joy at the news
His unadulterated greed destroyed many relationships

definitions: not influenced, changed, or damaged by something; remaining in original state
sincere and genuine in manner; free from artificiality or pretension
examples: The coastal areas remained unaffected by the storm
Her mood seemed unaffected by the bad news
His unaffected charm won everyone over immediately
She maintained an unaffected simplicity despite her fame

definitions: not officially attached to or connected with an organization, group, or particular body
examples: The unaffiliated voters could swing the election
She remained unaffiliated with any political party

definitions: feeling no fear or anxiety; brave and confident in facing something intimidating
examples: She remained unafraid despite the obvious danger
The unafraid child approached the large dog confidently

definitions: accomplished or functioning without help, assistance, or support from others or devices
examples: She completed the difficult task unaided by anyone
His unaided vision couldn't see the distant mountains

definitions: not transmitted or shown on television, radio, or other broadcast media
not exposed to fresh air or proper ventilation for freshening
examples: The unaired episodes remained in the studio vault
Several unaired pilots never made it to television
The unaired room smelled musty and stale
These unaired blankets need to go outside

definitions: remaining in the original state without any modifications, changes, or adjustments made
examples: The document remained unaltered since its creation
Her unaltered appearance surprised everyone after twenty years

definitions: relating to Lancaster or the House of Lancaster in English history
examples: The Lancastrian forces fought against the Yorkists
His Lancastrian heritage traced back several centuries

definitions: relating to Laos, its people, culture, or language in Southeast Asia
examples: The Lao cuisine features sticky rice prominently
She studied Lao history at the university

definitions: relating to Laos, its people, culture, or language in Southeast Asia
examples: The Laotian embassy hosted a cultural festival
Many Laotian refugees settled in this community

definitions: relating to the language, culture, or people of ancient Rome and its empire
relating to Latin America or people of Latin American origin or descent
examples: Students struggled with Latin grammar and vocabulary
The Latin inscription dated from the first century
The Latin music festival attracted thousands of visitors
Her Latin heritage influenced her artistic style

definitions: relating to people of Latin American origin or descent, especially those living in the United States
examples: The Latino community celebrated their cultural heritage
Several Latino artists displayed their work downtown

definitions: relating to Latvia, its people, culture, or language in the Baltic region
examples: The Latvian choir performed traditional folk songs
She learned Latvian to connect with her heritage

definitions: relating to Lebanon, its people, culture, or language in the Middle East
examples: The Lebanese restaurant served authentic mezze platters
Lebanese cedar trees are featured on their flag

definitions: relating to the Levant region in the Eastern Mediterranean, including modern Syria, Lebanon, Jordan, Israel, and Palestine
examples: The Levantine cuisine combines various Mediterranean influences
Ancient Levantine trade routes connected three continents

definitions: relating to Liberia, its people, culture, or language in West Africa
examples: The Liberian flag resembles the American flag closely
Liberian English has unique linguistic features

definitions: relating to Libya, its people, culture, or language in North Africa
examples: The Libyan desert covers much of the country
Libyan oil reserves are among the largest globally

definitions: relating to the biological classification system developed by Carl Linnaeus in the eighteenth century
examples: The Linnaean taxonomy revolutionized biological classification methods
Scientists still use Linnaean nomenclature for species naming

definitions: relating to the biological classification system developed by Carl Linnaeus in the eighteenth century
examples: The Linnean Society promotes biological research worldwide
Modern Linnean classification includes molecular data

definitions: relating to Lithuania, its people, culture, or language in the Baltic region
examples: Lithuanian is one of the oldest Indo-European languages
The Lithuanian basketball team won the championship

definitions: expressed in a way that makes only one interpretation possible; perfectly clear and precise
examples: The instructions were unambiguous and easy to follow
She gave an unambiguous answer to the question

definitions: shared by all members of a group with no one disagreeing or dissenting
examples: The jury reached a unanimous verdict after deliberation
Their unanimous support surprised the candidate

definitions: happening or arriving without warning, advance notice, or previous announcement to those affected
examples: The inspector made unannounced visits to restaurants
Her unannounced arrival caught everyone by surprise

definitions: not responded to or addressed; left without a reply, solution, or explanation
examples: Several unanswered questions remained after the meeting
Her unanswered calls worried her family greatly

definitions: not expected or predicted to happen; coming as a surprise without prior expectation
examples: The unanticipated costs exceeded their budget significantly
An unanticipated delay disrupted the entire schedule

definitions: not acknowledging or expressing regret for one's actions or statements; refusing to apologize
examples: She remained unapologetic about her controversial decision
His unapologetic attitude angered the victims further

definitions: not attractive, interesting, or tempting; failing to generate desire or positive interest
examples: The unappealing food sat untouched on plates
His unappealing proposal was quickly rejected

definitions: not carrying or equipped with weapons or arms for attack or defense
examples: The unarmed protesters faced the military peacefully
Police shot an unarmed man during the confrontation

definitions: lacking armor plating or protective covering against attack or damage
examples: The unarmored vehicle was vulnerable to attack
Unarmored targets were easy for the artillery

definitions: unable to be attacked, questioned, or defeated because of strength or protection
unable to be disputed or denied because of being obviously true or certain
examples: The fortress occupied an unassailable position on the cliff
Their unassailable defenses repelled every attack
Her logic was unassailable in its clarity
The evidence provided unassailable proof of guilt

definitions: not designated, allocated, or given to a particular person, purpose, or category
examples: Several unassigned parking spaces remained available
The unassigned students waited for group placement

definitions: done or achieved without help, aid, or support from others or devices
examples: She walked unassisted for the first time today
He scored an unassisted goal in overtime

definitions: not drawing attention to oneself; modest and unpretentious in manner or appearance
examples: His unassuming manner belied his great achievements
The unassuming restaurant served exceptional food

definitions: not fastened, joined, or connected to something else physically or organizationally
not involved in a committed romantic relationship; single and available
examples: The unattached garage stood separate from the house
Several unattached wires dangled from the ceiling
Many unattached professionals attended the singles event
She preferred remaining unattached after her divorce

definitions: not able to be reached, achieved, or acquired despite efforts; beyond one's grasp
examples: Her dreams seemed unattainable given her circumstances
The unattainable goal frustrated the entire team

definitions: not watched, supervised, or cared for; left alone without anyone present
examples: Never leave children unattended near the pool
The unattended luggage triggered a security alert

definitions: lacking beauty or pleasing appearance; not good-looking or visually appealing
not appealing as an option or choice; lacking desirable qualities or benefits
examples: The unattractive building spoiled the neighborhood view
He felt unattractive after gaining so much weight
The unattractive offer was immediately rejected
Rising costs made expansion an unattractive option

definitions: done without official permission or approval from the proper authority
examples: The unauthorised entry resulted in criminal charges
Unauthorised copying of software is illegal

definitions: done without official permission or approval from the proper authority
examples: Unauthorized personnel cannot enter this area
The unauthorized transaction was immediately flagged

definitions: not able to be used, reached, or obtained when needed or wanted
examples: The doctor was unavailable during the emergency
This item is currently unavailable for purchase

definitions: not able to be avoided, prevented, or ignored; certain to happen
examples: Death is an unavoidable part of life
The unavoidable delay frustrated waiting passengers

definitions: having no knowledge or consciousness of a situation or fact
examples: She remained unaware of the danger approaching
The unaware pedestrian crossed against the light

definitions: not in a state of equilibrium; unevenly distributed or lacking stability
emotionally or mentally disturbed; not showing normal mental stability
examples: The unbalanced load caused the washer to shake
Their unbalanced diet lacked essential nutrients
His unbalanced behavior worried his family members
The unbalanced individual needed professional help

definitions: so unpleasant, painful, or intense that one cannot endure or tolerate it
examples: The unbearable heat forced everyone inside
Her unbearable pain required immediate medical attention

definitions: so strong or skilled that defeat is impossible; invincible in competition
so good that nothing else can equal or exceed it; unsurpassable in quality
examples: Their unbeatable team won every championship
She proved unbeatable in chess tournaments
These prices are unbeatable anywhere else
The view from here is simply unbeatable
